intro: Alyssum illyricum, commonly known as the Balkan alyssum, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Alyssum illyricum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in garden landscapes.
